com.androidhiddencamera

Class CameraError

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.androidhiddencamera.CameraError

  • public final class CameraError
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Keval on 10-Nov-16. This class holds all the possible error codes can occur while initializing the camera.
    Author:
    'https://github.com/kevalpatel2106'

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      static interface  CameraError.CameraErrorCodes 

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ERROR_CAMERA_OPEN_FAILED
      This error can occur if there is any error while opening camera.
      static int ERROR_CAMERA_PERMISSION_NOT_AVAILABLE
      This error wil occur if the camera permission is not available.
      static int ERROR_DOES_NOT_HAVE_FRONT_CAMERA
      If the device does not have front facing camera and application tries to capture image using front facing camera, this error will occur.
      static int ERROR_DOES_NOT_HAVE_OVERDRAW_PERMISSION
      If the application does not have draw over other app permission, error will occur.
      static int ERROR_IMAGE_WRITE_FAILED
      This error code will be generated when application is not able to write the captured image into output file provide.

    • Field Detail

      • ERROR_CAMERA_OPEN_FAILED

        public static final int ERROR_CAMERA_OPEN_FAILED
        This error can occur if there is any error while opening camera. Mostly because another application is using the camera.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ERROR_CAMERA_PERMISSION_NOT_AVAILABLE

        public static final int ERROR_CAMERA_PERMISSION_NOT_AVAILABLE
        This error wil occur if the camera permission is not available. Developer should ask user for the runtime permission and once the permission granted, should try the to initialize the camera again.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ERROR_DOES_NOT_HAVE_OVERDRAW_PERMISSION

        public static final int ERROR_DOES_NOT_HAVE_OVERDRAW_PERMISSION
        If the application does not have draw over other app permission, error will occur. This permission is available to all the application below Android M ( Apps -> Gear icon on top-right corner -> Draw Over other apps.

        This error can occur only while using the hidden camera from the service using HiddenCameraService. Developer should check if the Manifest.permission.SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW permission is defined in the AndroidManifest.xml and display information dialog/snackbar to the user, explaining steps to grant draw over other app permission.

        Developer can open permission grant screen using HiddenCameraUtils.openDrawOverPermissionSetting(Context).

        Note: This error will stop the service. Developer has to start service once "Draw over other app" permission is granted. You can check if the permission is available by calling HiddenCameraUtils.canOverDrawOtherApps(Context).

        See Also:
        'http://www.androidpolice.com/2015/09/07/android-m-begins-locking-down-floating-apps-requires-users-to-grant-special-permission-to-draw-on-other-apps/', Constant Field Values

      • ERROR_DOES_NOT_HAVE_FRONT_CAMERA

        public static final int ERROR_DOES_NOT_HAVE_FRONT_CAMERA
        If the device does not have front facing camera and application tries to capture image using front facing camera, this error will occur.

        Developer can check if the device has front camera or not by using HiddenCameraUtils.isFrontCameraAvailable(Context) before initializing the camera.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ERROR_IMAGE_WRITE_FAILED

        public static final int ERROR_IMAGE_WRITE_FAILED
        This error code will be generated when application is not able to write the captured image into output file provide.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
